definitions.definition: Diverse in kind or nature ; composed of diverse parts .
examples: He had a large and heterogeneous collection of books.

definitions.definition: Having more than one phase ( solid , liquid , gas ) present in a system or process .

Of a network comprising different types of computers, potentially with vastly differing memory sizes, processing power and even basic underlying architecture; alternatively, of a data resource with multiple types of formats.

main_definition: Diverse in kind or nature ; composed of diverse parts .
secondary_definitions: ( mathematics ) Incommensurable because of different kinds.
( physics , chemistry ) Having more than one phase ( solid , liquid , gas ) present in a system or process .
( chemistry ) Visibly consisting of different components.

( computing ) Of a network comprising different types of computers, potentially with vastly differing memory sizes, processing power and even basic underlying architecture; alternatively, of a data resource with multiple types of formats.
